overview:
## Discussion

You can employ the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/title] property as needed for your app’s user interface, such as to enable a user to choose among multiple named views in a menu or other affordance. The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController] class does not use this property for its own purposes.

The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/title] property is key-value coding and key-value observing compliant.

# title

**Instance Property**

The localized title of the receiver’s primary view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var title: String? { get set }
```

## Discussion

You can employ the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/title] property as needed for your app’s user interface, such as to enable a user to choose among multiple named views in a menu or other affordance. The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController] class does not use this property for its own purposes.

The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/title] property is key-value coding and key-value observing compliant.

## View Properties

- **view**: The view controller’s primary view.
title: title
